snippet: Jets punt returner Jeremy Kerley left last week’s game against the Giants with a “sharp, shooting, throbbing pain,” and experts wonder if contact sports can contribute to frequent or chronic headaches later in life.
abstract: New York Jets punt returner Jeremy Kerley is among number of NFL players who suffer regularly from migraines, along with college football players; topic is not openly discussed by NFL, but study by Dr Tad Seifert, neurologist and chair of NCAA task force on headaches, suggests link between migraines and concussions.
lead_paragraph: Jets punt returner Jeremy Kerley left last week’s game against the Giants with a “sharp, shooting, throbbing pain,” and experts wonder if contact sports can contribute to frequent or chronic headaches later in life.

headline.main: ‘You Can’t Put Ice Over a Migraine,’ a Lurking Malady in the N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: ‘You Can’t Put Ice Over a Migraine,’ a Lurking Malady in the N.F.L.
